response: Oh, amigo, I must shoot you for lying.
context/0: None.
context/1: Tell me, how much money you got?

context: That grinning, glowing, globular invader of your living room is an inhabitant of the pumpkin patch.
response: And ah-- if your doorbell rings and nobody's there, that was no Martian, it's Halloween.
context/0: So, good bye everybody, and remember please, for the next day or so, the terrible lesson you learned tonight.
context/1: Now, you will be relieved, I hope, to learn that we didn't mean it and that both institutions are still open for business.
context/2: We annihilated the world before your very ears and utterly destroyed the Columbia Broadcasting System.
context/3: Starting now, we couldn't soap all your windows and steal all your garden gates by tomorrow night, so we did the next best thing.
context/5: The Mercury Theatre's own radio version of dressing up in a sheet and jumping out of a bush and saying, boo!
context/6: This is your host, ladies and gentlemen, out of character to assure you that "The War Of The Worlds" has no further significance than as the holiday offering it was intended to be.
context/8: Turn to CBS.
context/9: It oughtta be on every station in the world.
